ShortDescription: IFIM Institutions was established in 1995 by the DSIJ (Dalal Street Investment Journal) Group and was promoted by the Centre for Developmental Education

Highlights.name: A Group of Educational Institutions
Highlights.description: IFIM Institutions is a group of educational institutions that offers undergraduate, postgraduate and integrated programs [1]. This means that IFIM Institutions can provide students with a well-rounded education at all levels of their academic journey.

Highlights.name: Specialization in Management, Law and Technology
Highlights.description: The Schools offered are IFIM School of Management, IFIM School of Law and IFIM School of Technology [1]. This focus on specific fields allows IFIM Institutions to provide students with in-depth knowledge and skills in these high-demand areas.

Highlights.name: Focus on Holistic Development
Highlights.description: IFIM Institutions focuses on holistic development of students [1]. This suggests that they go beyond just academics and provide students with opportunities to develop their personal and professional skills.

enhanced_description: IFIM Institutions, established in 1995 by the DSIJ Group and promoted by the Centre for Developmental Education, functions as a group of educational institutions. It specializes in offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and integrated programs with a particular focus on Management, Law, and Technology. IFIM employs a knowledge delivery model executed by highly committed faculty who bring extensive industry, research, and consultancy experience, complemented by visiting professionals. The institution emphasizes quality management education, customized programs, and the holistic development of students to produce continuously employable professionals. Positioned within the Learning and Development sector, IFIM also serves as a Corporate LMS and training & development company, supporting corporate initiatives, including the objective to build a more diverse and inclusive workforce through its offerings.
